author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Upon Yellen’s word, progress be made,
'Bout U.S., China, and their trade.
To listen well, the secret key,
In matters of security.

In Ukraine, the struggle slow,
'Gainst entrenched enemy they go.
Outgunned, outnumbered, attempt they do,
A daunting task, for the stronger, few.

In midst of war and internal strife,
Unite, NATO seeks, to protect life.
Despite shadows cast by spending and Swedes,
In unity, strength indeed breeds.

feedItems.title: Janet Yellen Says U.S., China Making Progress on Managing Economic Tensions
feedItems.description: The Treasury secretary said Washington would listen to Beijing’s concerns on national-security issues.

feedItems.title: Why the Ukraine Counteroffensive Is Such Slow Going
feedItems.description: Outgunned, outmanned and facing a deeply entrenched enemy, Ukrainian troops are attempting one of the most daunting operations a military can undertake.

feedItems.title: Amid Ukraine War and Internal Spats, NATO Seeks Show of Unity
feedItems.description: Summit in Lithuania aims to showcase cohesion against Russia. But fights over Sweden joining and spending levels cast a shadow.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
A battle unfolds in the market's midst, so tight,
"Inflation's final furlong shall be the hardest," is the knight.
Housing cost and carriage used, their values we'll recite,
Yet endure, we'll stall, if the purse does not alight. 

Hark! Hear news from the realm where Snap resides,
In fair tempt of creators, for this message presides.
Sales once declining, a lament through the tides,
Courting with new vigour, the merchant's fortune abides.

And last, an earnest tale worthy of a bard's sweet thrill,
To leave your gold for grandchild's bloom and not the taxman's fill.
The rules of old have shifted, thus bearing a novel will,
Rewrite thy plans fief, ‘fore thy coffers spill.

feedItems.title: Last Mile of the Inflation Fight Will Be the Hardest
feedItems.description: Lower housing and used-car costs are expected to push down the core index, but progress could then stall so long as the economy doesn’t weaken.

feedItems.title: Snap's Push to Tempt Creators Seems to Be Working
feedItems.description: Social-media app Snapchat is trying to counter declining sales.

feedItems.title: How to Leave Grandkids Your Retirement Savings---and Not a Huge Tax Bill
feedItems.description: The new rules for inherited IRAs might warrant a rewrite of your estate plan.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In yonder hall where flavor lacks,
And noble men their parkings attack,
Goats graze 'pon food, bland and meek,
In favored spot of the elite.

Beneath shadow's rare eclipse,
In Garden Inn, rest nightingales' lips,
For Texarkana's lofty night,
Rabbits pay a fee of fright.

A snail on a journey slow and dear,
Loses gold each passing year,
Yet within this crawling pace,
A dog finds coin in hiding space.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: The food is meh, the decor is bland and parking's impossible—it's the favorite restaurant of America's elite

feedItems.title: You're Already Too Late If You Want to Book a Room for the 2024 Eclipse
feedItems.description: Fanatics snap up accommodations for next April’s sensation; a Hilton Garden Inn in Texarkana for $743 a night.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: How to make money by losing $300,000 a year

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In the noble halls of science art borne,
Jenkins standeth, as day greets the morn.
Urging the greatest grid to forge anew,
To stymie the vengeance of Hel's icy dew.

Alas, in California the Valkyries' wail does soar,
Six souls taken in fiery jet's roar.
The All-Father's agents in their questioning rite,
Seek truth in the charred wreckage's terrible sight.

From the wild Texan land, a tale doth stir,
Of barrier buoys, on the Rio Grande they purr.
A tide of wanderers they aim to quell,
In this mortal saga, only time will tell.

feedItems.title: The Professor Helping Guide Billions in Climate Spending
feedItems.description: Jesse Jenkins’s ZERO Lab says that faster upgrades for the power grid are essential to cutting emissions.

feedItems.title: Six People Killed After Small Jet Crashes, Catches Fire in California
feedItems.description: Everybody on board was pronounced dead at the scene. The National Transportation Safety Board and the Federal Aviation Administration are investigating the incident.

feedItems.title: Texas Uses Large Buoys in Effort to Stop Illegal Crossings
feedItems.description: Work began Friday to build a 1,000-foot-long barrier that will float in the Rio Grande.
